answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Chronic diarrhea can be due to parasitic infestations.  Other causes are irritable bowel syndrome, celiac disease, crohn’s disease, malabsorption syndromes, pancreatic diseases, diabetes, hyperthyroidism etc. Since you have had the problem for last four years you have lost weight too. If celiac, Crohn’s and other problems have been ruled out then lactose intolerance and IBS are the possibilities. Gas in stomach, burping, diarrhea all go in favor of IBS. Pancreatic enzyme disorders, liver dysfunction, HIV, cancer of the gut, and infections by parasites other than giardia can all cause persisting diarrhea. Please get the stool examined and consult a gastroenterologist.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

My sister used to have all sorts of digestive problems and I suggested she start drinking soy milk or another milk substitute.  It really helped so maybe you are lactose intolerant.  It sounds like you have other medical issues (but really who doesn't?) but switching from milk products to almond milk, soy milk or lactose free milk might help.  What kind of rash do you get on your face?  My skin used to get a little red if I didn't take my vitamins but it always goes away when I do.  I guess I have a vitamin deficiency.  Do you take a multi vitamin?
